page.title: 19HOSPITAL AND PUMPING STATION
page.content: The hospital occupies a 4 acre site beside the Calderdale Way/Elland By- pass. Initial planning permission was requested in January 1984, the completion date is July 1985, cost is 3 million pounds. It is build of Marshall's Cromwell reconstituted stone made in Soukthowram. It was designed by Watkins Gray Int. U.K Ltd. of Kent for United Medical Enterprises London. It contains Operating theatre, day patient facilities, X-ray physiotherapy, a pharmacy dept. and 40 bedrooms. It will employ 125 people, including 70 nurses, working a shift system. LOWFIELD sewage works is now used mainly as a pumping station, virtually unmanned. Many complaints came from residents about the stench from solid waste deposited there and plans are under discussion to solve this.
